intro: Sersalisia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty sersalisia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in clusters. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
